description:
The world is ruled by a diversity of inhuman beings, who persecuted humans and drove them to near-extinction. One day, the forest guardian Golem meets a human girl. This is a chronicle of a journey that would bind a member of the dying "human" clan to the forest guardian Golem, as father and daughter.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

The first episode received an advance web distribution on January 3. The regular TV broadcast started on January 10.
synonyms: Somari and the Guardian of the Forest
Somali et l'esprit de la forêt

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Elderly Protagonist
tags.description: The protagonist is either over 60 years of age, has an elderly appearance, or, in the case of non-humans, is considered elderly for their species.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

name.native: ニエム・ヴィンセント

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤郁子)

Known for her work as a character designer on [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) and [Princess Tutu](https://anilist.co/anime/721/).
**Mochizuki Mariko** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱野高年)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule.

__Height:__ 154 cm 
__Agency:__ AXL-ONE

__[Website](https://inoriminase.com)__ | __[Profile (AXL-ONE)](http://axl-one.com/talent/minase.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inoriminase)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/inoriminase_info/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYBwKaLwCGY7k3auR_FLanA)__

A Japanese voice actress and singer-songwriter under entertainment agency Axlone (2017–) and record label King Records (2015–), having previously been under entertainment agency Sony Music Entertainment (2010–2017). She has been active as a voice actor since 2010, debuting in the anime Occult Academy voicing the character Akari Okamoto, while debuting as a singer-songwriter in December 2015.

Inori was born in Tokyo, where she began watching anime in kindergarten. She first became aware of voice acting when, after watching a stage play adaption of an anime, she read the stage pamphlet and asked her parents about a person mentioned in it. She found out that she wanted to become a voice actor at the age of six, and at elementary school she listed voice acting as her desired future career. 

In middle school, Inori joined her school's tennis and theater clubs, however, she quit the theater club due to feeling too embarrassed when appearing on stage. Around the same time, her mother found a magazine advertising for a voice-acting audition, which she participated in and won.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

**Non-anime roles:**
- Iris - Memento Mori (VG)
- Soline - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Furina - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Balloon Party - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

**[Website](http://www.keikawano.com/pages/main.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/keikawano)**

**Birthplace:** Tokyo, Japan

**Kawano Kei** is a Japanese music producer, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

__Height:__ 154 cm 
__Agency:__ AXL-ONE

__[Website](https://inoriminase.com)__ | __[Profile (AXL-ONE)](http://axl-one.com/talent/minase.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inoriminase)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/inoriminase_info/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYBwKaLwCGY7k3auR_FLanA)__

A Japanese voice actress and singer-songwriter under entertainment agency Axlone (2017–) and record label King Records (2015–), having previously been under entertainment agency Sony Music Entertainment (2010–2017). She has been active as a voice actor since 2010, debuting in the anime Occult Academy voicing the character Akari Okamoto, while debuting as a singer-songwriter in December 2015.

Inori was born in Tokyo, where she began watching anime in kindergarten. She first became aware of voice acting when, after watching a stage play adaption of an anime, she read the stage pamphlet and asked her parents about a person mentioned in it. She found out that she wanted to become a voice actor at the age of six, and at elementary school she listed voice acting as her desired future career. 

In middle school, Inori joined her school's tennis and theater clubs, however, she quit the theater club due to feeling too embarrassed when appearing on stage. Around the same time, her mother found a magazine advertising for a voice-acting audition, which she participated in and won.

**Non-anime roles:**
- Iris - Memento Mori (VG)
- Soline - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Furina - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Balloon Party - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__Birthplace:__ Toride City, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

__Yuusuke Shirato__ is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist and musician.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pik_pipi)__

__Hikaru Sakurazawa__ is a Japanese lyricist and composer.

__[Website](https://kite-web.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/SETSUNA_KIKAKU)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Spouse:__ [Yukiko Motoya](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9C%AC%E8%B0%B7%E6%9C%89%E5%B8%8C%E5%AD%90) (May 7, 2013–)
__Nicknames:__ かっくん (Kakkun), おかちゃん (Oka-chan)

__Kei Sugawara__, alternatively known by pseudonym Kite Okachimachi, is a Japanese lyricist, who is known to collaborate with [Naotarou Moriyama](https://anilist.co/staff/151343/Naotarou-Moriyama).

__[Website](http://www.akirayamaoka.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AkiraYamaoka)__

Akira Yamaoka is a Japanese music composer and sound designer prevalently known for being the main music composer of the Silent Hill videogame series.
